channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Treasury Yields Look for Direction
item.description: The 10-year Treasury yield was up and FlowCommunity said Treasury yields weren’t showing decisive movements at a moment when the dollar was also stead...

item.title: ‘I want to enjoy the rest of my years’: I’m 65, retired and own my home. I have $300,000 to invest. What should I do with it?
Are Intel's Problems Too Big to Fix?
item.description: Pat Gelsinger’s exit might open some options, but Intel’s struggles in manufacturing technology and market shifts are still significant.

item.title: Oil Gains 1% But Trading Range Remains Narrow Ahead of OPEC+
item.description: Oil was around 1% higher ahead of Thursday’s OPEC+ output policy meeting where it is widely expected to delay its planned production restart beyond Ja...

item.title: What are the ‘Brics’ countries — and are they really trying to leave the dollar like Trump says?
item.description: In his latest trade-related tirade, President-elect Donald Trump has set his sights on a group of emerging-market countries collectively known as the ...

item.title: My friend declared bankruptcy. Can creditors still go after him for child support, back taxes and student debt?
item.description: “Most of those old debts are credit-card debts.”

item.title: ‘I’m trying not to go bankrupt’: My husband of 24 years asked for a divorce. He wants my cell-phone records. Should I report him for tax fraud?
item.description: “I would like to keep the house because my grown children and grandchildren reside there.”

item.title: U.S. Steel shares drop on Trump’s pledge to block Nippon Steel takeover
item.description: U.S. Steel Corp. shares fell 7% in Tuesday’s pre-market trading session after President-elect Donald Trump pledged to block Nippon Steel’s plans to ac...

item.title: Stock Futures Waver With JOLTS Jobs Data Due
item.description: Stock futures were little changed with some investors bracing for volatility at the end of this week, when official jobs data for November are due.

item.title: BlackRock Strikes $12 Billion Deal for HPS, Doubling Down on Wall Street's Hottest Market
item.description: The roughly $12 billion all-stock deal would substantially add to BlackRock’s coveted private asset pile.
